updates.title: Google's Gemini 3 launch with breakthrough coding capabilities signals intensified competition in AI development tools, potentially reshaping design workflows as coding assistants become more sophisticated.

Adobe's $1.9 billion Semrush acquisition expands its AI-powered marketing suite, positioning the company to dominate the entire creative-to-marketing pipeline as agencies increasingly need integrated solutions.

OpenAI's retail expansion with Target and Intuit partnerships ($100M+ deal) indicates AI assistants will soon handle complex shopping and financial tasks, creating new opportunities for conversational commerce design.

TikTok's AI content controls and Europe's cookie policy changes suggest a shift toward user-controlled algorithmic experiences, indicating platforms will need more transparent and customizable design interfaces.

Massive funding rounds for AI infrastructure companies like Lambda ($1.5B) and Databricks ($130B+ valuation talks) signal continued enterprise AI investment, suggesting more sophisticated AI tools for creative workflows ahead.
